required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Rocuronium Plus Sugammadex Versus Succinylcholine Alone in Participants Undergoing Short Surgical Procedures (19.4.319)(P05700 AM2)(COMPLETED)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center, Randomized, Parallel Group, Comparative, Active Controlled, Safety Assessor Blinded Trial in Adult Subjects Comparing Rocuronium Plus Sugammadex Versus Succinylcholine Alone in Subjects Undergoing Short Surgical Procedures in Out-patient Surgicenters

brief_summary.textblock: A multi-center, randomized, parallel group, comparative, active controlled, safety assessor blinded trial in adult subjects comparing rocuronium plus sugammadex versus succinylcholine alone in subjects undergoing short surgical procedures in out-patient surgicenters. The primary objective was to evaluate changes in plasma potassium levels after treatment with rocuronium, sugammadex, or succinylcholine in adult subjects scheduled for short surgical procedures in out-patient surgicenters.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Plasma Potassium Levels at 5 Minutes After Treatment With Rocuronium or Succinylcholine
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline = 5 minutes post dose value - baseline value. Baseline levels were obtained prior to rocuronium or succinylcholine dose. Only data post rocuronium dose are included for "rocuronium - sugammadex" group. The change from baseline interval included most or all of the intubation/surgical period for sugammadex analysis (since sugammadex was administered at the end of the surgical procedure) but not for succinylcholine or rocuronium analyses (since these were administered immediately after the baseline measurement just prior to intubation/commencement of the surgical period).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Plasma Potassium Levels at 5 Minutes After Treatment With Sugammadex
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline = 5 minutes post dose value - baseline value. Baseline levels were obtained prior to rocuronium dose. Only data post sugammadex dose are included for "rocuronium - sugammadex" group. The change from baseline interval included most or all of the intubation/surgical period for sugammadex analysis (since sugammadex was administered at the end of the surgical procedure) but not for succinylcholine or rocuronium analyses (since these were administered immediately after the baseline measurement just prior to intubation/commencement of the surgical period).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Plasma Potassium Levels at 2 Minutes After Treatment With Rocuronium or Succinylcholine
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline = 2 minutes post dose value - baseline value. Baseline levels were obtained prior to rocuronium or succinylcholine dose. Only data post rocuronium dose are included for "rocuronium - sugammadex" group. The change from baseline interval included most or all of the intubation/surgical period for sugammadex analysis (since sugammadex was administered at the end of the surgical procedure) but not for succinylcholine or rocuronium analyses (since these were administered immediately after the baseline measurement just prior to intubation/commencement of the surgical period).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Plasma Potassium Levels at 2 Minutes After Treatment With Sugammadex
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline = 2 minutes post dose value - baseline value. Baseline levels were obtained prior to rocuronium dose. Only data post sugammadex dose are included for "rocuronium - sugammadex" group. The change from baseline interval included most or all of the intubation/surgical period for sugammadex analysis (since sugammadex was administered at the end of the surgical procedure) but not for succinylcholine or rocuronium analyses (since these were administered immediately after the baseline measurement just prior to intubation/commencement of the surgical period).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Plasma Potassium Levels at 10 Minutes After Treatment With Rocuronium or Succinylcholine
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline = 10 minutes post dose value - baseline value. Baseline levels were obtained prior to rocuronium or succinylcholine dose. Only data post rocuronium dose are included for "rocuronium - sugammadex" group. The change from baseline interval included most or all of the intubation/surgical period for sugammadex analysis (since sugammadex was administered at the end of the surgical procedure) but not for succinylcholine or rocuronium analyses (since these were administered immediately after the baseline measurement just prior to intubation/commencement of the surgical period).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Plasma Potassium Levels at 10 Minutes After Treatment With Sugammadex
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline = 10 minutes post dose value - baseline value. Baseline levels were obtained prior to rocuronium dose. Only data post sugammadex dose are included for "rocuronium - sugammadex" group. The change from baseline interval included most or all of the intubation/surgical period for sugammadex analysis (since sugammadex was administered at the end of the surgical procedure) but not for succinylcholine or rocuronium analyses (since these were administered immediately after the baseline measurement just prior to intubation/commencement of the surgical period).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Plasma Potassium Levels at 15 Minutes After Treatment With Rocuronium or Succinylcholine
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline = 15 minutes post dose value - baseline value. Baseline levels were obtained prior to rocuronium or succinylcholine dose. Only data post rocuronium dose are included for "rocuronium - sugammadex" group. The change from baseline interval included most or all of the intubation/surgical period for sugammadex analysis (since sugammadex was administered at the end of the surgical procedure) but not for succinylcholine or rocuronium analyses (since these were administered immediately after the baseline measurement just prior to intubation/commencement of the surgical period).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Plasma Potassium Levels at 15 Minutes After Treatment With Sugammadex
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline = 15 minutes post dose value - baseline value. Baseline levels were obtained prior to rocuronium dose. Only data post sugammadex dose are included for "rocuronium - sugammadex" group. The change from baseline interval included most or all of the intubation/surgical period for sugammadex analysis (since sugammadex was administered at the end of the surgical procedure) but not for succinylcholine or rocuronium analyses (since these were administered immediately after the baseline measurement just prior to intubation/commencement of the surgical period).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With at Least One Adverse Event (AE) in Rocuronium - Sugammadex and Succinylcholine Treatment Groups
secondary_outcome.description: Only AEs which occurred following administration of sugammadex or succinylcholine are included. AEs in the rocuronium - sugammadex group occurring after rocuronium but before sugammadex administration are considered "pretreatment" events and are not included. The AE reporting interval included the entire intubation/surgical period for the succinylcholine group (since succinylcholine was administered just prior to intubation/commencement of surgery) but not for the rocuronium - sugammadex group (since sugammadex was administered at the end of the surgical procedure).

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Recovery of the Fourth Twitch/First Twitch (T4/T1) Ratio to 0.9 Following Administration of 4.0 mg/kg of Sugammadex After Neuromuscular Blockade Induced by Rocuronium
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of administration of sugammadex to recovery from neuromuscular blockade (Up to approximately 6 minutes)
secondary_outcome.description: Neuromuscular functioning was monitored by applying repetitive train of four (TOF) electrical stimulations to the ulnar nerve every 15 seconds and assessing twitch response at the adductor pollicis muscle. Nerve stimulation continued until the ratio of the magnitude of the fourth twitch (T4) to first twitch (T1) reached at least 0.9. The greater the T4/T1 ratio the greater the recovery from neuromuscular blockade, with a value of 1.0 representing full recovery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Recovery of T1 to 90% of Baseline Following Neuromuscular Blockade Induced by Succinylcholine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of administration of succinylcholine to recovery from neuromuscular blockade (Up to approximately 18 minutes)
secondary_outcome.description: Neuromuscular functioning was monitored by applying repetitive train of four (TOF) electrical stimulations to the ulnar nerve every 15 seconds and assessing twitch response at the adductor pollicis muscle. Nerve stimulation continued until recovery of T1 of 90% of baseline and full recovery of neuromuscular function occurred as determined by the anesthesiologist as per routine clinical practice.

intervention.description: A single bolus intubation dose of 0.6 mg/kg rocuronium will be administered following induction of anesthesia and if required, single bolus dose(s) of 0.15 mg/kg rocuronium will be administered to maintain the neuromuscular block.
At the end of the surgical procedure at a target depth of neuromuscular blockade of at least 1-2 Post-Tetanic Count (PTC), 4.0 mg/kg of sugammadex will be administered.
A single bolus intubation dose of 1.0 mg/kg succinylcholine will be administered following induction of anesthesia and the subject is allowed to recover spontaneously from the neuromuscular blockade.
intervention.other_name: Quelicin® (succinylcholine chloride injection United States Pharmacopeia [USP])

results_reference.citation: Soto R, Jahr JS, Pavlin J, Sabo D, Philip BK, Egan TD, Rowe E, de Bie J, Woo T. Safety and Efficacy of Rocuronium With Sugammadex Reversal Versus Succinylcholine in Outpatient Surgery-A Multicenter, Randomized, Safety Assessor-Blinded Trial. Am J Ther. 2016 Nov/Dec;23(6):e1654-e1662.

group.title: Rocuronium - Sugammadex
group.description: An intubation dose of rocuronium (roc) was administered following induction of anesthesia and, if required, maintenance doses were administered to maintain the neuromuscular block. At the end of the surgical procedure sugammadex (sug) was administered for reversal of neuromuscular blockade.

group.title: Succinylcholine
group.description: An intubation dose of succinylcholine (suc) was administered following induction of anesthesia and the subject was allowed to recover spontaneously from the neuromuscular blockade.

participants_list.participants: 10 of 76 randomized were not treated with sugammadex; 4 of these 10 received rocuronium only
5 of 85 randomized were not treated with succinylcholine

group.title: Rocuronium - Sugammadex
group.description: An intubation dose of rocuronium was administered following induction of anesthesia and, if required, maintenance doses were administered to maintain the neuromuscular block. At the end of the surgical procedure sugammadex was administered for reversal of neuromuscular blockade.

group.title: Succinylcholine
group.description: An intubation dose of succinylcholine was administered following induction of anesthesia and the subject was allowed to recover spontaneously from the neuromuscular blockade.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Includes only participants who were randomized and treated with sugammadex or succinylcholine

measure.title: Gender
measure.description: Includes only participants who were randomized and treated with sugammadex or succinylcholine

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Plasma Potassium Levels at 5 Minutes After Treatment With Rocuronium or Succinylcholine
outcome.description: Change from baseline = 5 minutes post dose value - baseline value. Baseline levels were obtained prior to rocuronium or succinylcholine dose. Only data post rocuronium dose are included for "rocuronium - sugammadex" group. The change from baseline interval included most or all of the intubation/surgical period for sugammadex analysis (since sugammadex was administered at the end of the surgical procedure) but not for succinylcholine or rocuronium analyses (since these were administered immediately after the baseline measurement just prior to intubation/commencement of the surgical period).
outcome.population: Participants who received rocuronium or succinylcholine with evaluable (i.e., not missing or hemolyzed) blood samples for potassium measurement at baseline and at the 5 minute post-dose time point.

group.title: Rocuronium - Sugammadex
group.description: An intubation dose of rocuronium was administered following induction of anesthesia and, if required, maintenance doses were administered to maintain the neuromuscular block. At the end of the surgical procedure sugammadex was administered for reversal of neuromuscular blockade.

group.title: Succinylcholine
group.description: An intubation dose of succinylcholine was administered following induction of anesthesia and the subject was allowed to recover spontaneously from the neuromuscular blockade.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Plasma Potassium Levels at 5 Minutes After Treatment With Rocuronium or Succinylcholine
measure.description: Change from baseline = 5 minutes post dose value - baseline value. Baseline levels were obtained prior to rocuronium or succinylcholine dose. Only data post rocuronium dose are included for "rocuronium - sugammadex" group. The change from baseline interval included most or all of the intubation/surgical period for sugammadex analysis (since sugammadex was administered at the end of the surgical procedure) but not for succinylcholine or rocuronium analyses (since these were administered immediately after the baseline measurement just prior to intubation/commencement of the surgical period).
measure.population: Participants who received rocuronium or succinylcholine with evaluable (i.e., not missing or hemolyzed) blood samples for potassium measurement at baseline and at the 5 minute post-dose time point.

analysis.groups_desc: Treatment comparison was between the change from baseline in potassium level post-rocuronium dose versus post-succinylcholine dose, using a one way ANOVA model, with treatment as the term in the model.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With at Least One Adverse Event (AE) in Rocuronium - Sugammadex and Succinylcholine Treatment Groups
outcome.description: Only AEs which occurred following administration of sugammadex or succinylcholine are included. AEs in the rocuronium - sugammadex group occurring after rocuronium but before sugammadex administration are considered "pretreatment" events and are not included. The AE reporting interval included the entire intubation/surgical period for the succinylcholine group (since succinylcholine was administered just prior to intubation/commencement of surgery) but not for the rocuronium - sugammadex group (since sugammadex was administered at the end of the surgical procedure).
outcome.population: Participants who received sugammadex or succinylcholine.

group.description: An intubation dose of rocuronium was administered following induction of anesthesia and, if required, maintenance doses were administered to maintain the neuromuscular block. At the end of the surgical procedure sugammadex was administered for reversal of neuromuscular blockade.

measure.title: Number of Participants With at Least One Adverse Event (AE) in Rocuronium - Sugammadex and Succinylcholine Treatment Groups
measure.description: Only AEs which occurred following administration of sugammadex or succinylcholine are included. AEs in the rocuronium - sugammadex group occurring after rocuronium but before sugammadex administration are considered "pretreatment" events and are not included. The AE reporting interval included the entire intubation/surgical period for the succinylcholine group (since succinylcholine was administered just prior to intubation/commencement of surgery) but not for the rocuronium - sugammadex group (since sugammadex was administered at the end of the surgical procedure).
measure.population: Participants who received sugammadex or succinylcholine.

outcome.title: Time to Recovery of the Fourth Twitch/First Twitch (T4/T1) Ratio to 0.9 Following Administration of 4.0 mg/kg of Sugammadex After Neuromuscular Blockade Induced by Rocuronium
outcome.description: Neuromuscular functioning was monitored by applying repetitive train of four (TOF) electrical stimulations to the ulnar nerve every 15 seconds and assessing twitch response at the adductor pollicis muscle. Nerve stimulation continued until the ratio of the magnitude of the fourth twitch (T4) to first twitch (T1) reached at least 0.9. The greater the T4/T1 ratio the greater the recovery from neuromuscular blockade, with a value of 1.0 representing full recovery.
outcome.time_frame: Start of administration of sugammadex to recovery from neuromuscular blockade (Up to approximately 6 minutes)
outcome.population: Participants who received both rocuronium and sugammadex and had evaluable neuromuscular function data determined to be reliable by a central independent adjudication committee.

group.title: Rocuronium - Sugammadex
group.description: An intubation dose of rocuronium was administered following induction of anesthesia and, if required, maintenance doses were administered to maintain the neuromuscular block. At the end of the surgical procedure sugammadex was administered for reversal of neuromuscular blockade.

measure.title: Time to Recovery of the Fourth Twitch/First Twitch (T4/T1) Ratio to 0.9 Following Administration of 4.0 mg/kg of Sugammadex After Neuromuscular Blockade Induced by Rocuronium
measure.description: Neuromuscular functioning was monitored by applying repetitive train of four (TOF) electrical stimulations to the ulnar nerve every 15 seconds and assessing twitch response at the adductor pollicis muscle. Nerve stimulation continued until the ratio of the magnitude of the fourth twitch (T4) to first twitch (T1) reached at least 0.9. The greater the T4/T1 ratio the greater the recovery from neuromuscular blockade, with a value of 1.0 representing full recovery.
measure.population: Participants who received both rocuronium and sugammadex and had evaluable neuromuscular function data determined to be reliable by a central independent adjudication committee.

outcome.title: Time to Recovery of T1 to 90% of Baseline Following Neuromuscular Blockade Induced by Succinylcholine
outcome.description: Neuromuscular functioning was monitored by applying repetitive train of four (TOF) electrical stimulations to the ulnar nerve every 15 seconds and assessing twitch response at the adductor pollicis muscle. Nerve stimulation continued until recovery of T1 of 90% of baseline and full recovery of neuromuscular function occurred as determined by the anesthesiologist as per routine clinical practice.
outcome.time_frame: Start of administration of succinylcholine to recovery from neuromuscular blockade (Up to approximately 18 minutes)
outcome.population: Participants who received succinylcholine and had evaluable neuromuscular function data determined to be reliable by a central independent adjudication committee.

group.title: Succinylcholine
group.description: An intubation dose of succinylcholine was administered following induction of anesthesia and the subject was allowed to recover spontaneously from the neuromuscular blockade.

measure.title: Time to Recovery of T1 to 90% of Baseline Following Neuromuscular Blockade Induced by Succinylcholine
measure.description: Neuromuscular functioning was monitored by applying repetitive train of four (TOF) electrical stimulations to the ulnar nerve every 15 seconds and assessing twitch response at the adductor pollicis muscle. Nerve stimulation continued until recovery of T1 of 90% of baseline and full recovery of neuromuscular function occurred as determined by the anesthesiologist as per routine clinical practice.
measure.population: Participants who received succinylcholine and had evaluable neuromuscular function data determined to be reliable by a central independent adjudication committee.

reported_events.desc: Includes only AEs post sugammadex or succinylcholine. AE reporting interval included entire intubation/surgical period for succinylcholine group (since succinylcholine was administered just prior to intubation/commencement of surgery) but not for rocuronium - sugammadex group (since sugammadex was administered at the end of the surgical procedure).

group.title: Rocuronium - Sugammadex
group.description: An intubation dose of rocuronium was administered following induction of anesthesia and, if required, maintenance doses were administered to maintain the neuromuscular block. At the end of the surgical procedure sugammadex was administered for reversal of neuromuscular blockade.

group.title: Succinylcholine
group.description: An intubation dose of succinylcholine was administered following induction of anesthesia and the subject was allowed to recover spontaneously from the neuromuscular blockade.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If a proposed publication contains reference to an invention owned by the Sponsor or to which the Sponsor otherwise has rights, the Sponsor may request a reasonable suspension of the publication in order to be able to file a patent application protecting such invention.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The potassium change from baseline interval included most/all of the intubation/surgical period for the sug but not the suc or roc analysis. AE reporting interval included the entire intubation/surgery period for the suc but not the roc-sug group.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
